tree_collapse_species.py - collapse single species nodes¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

Purpose¶

This script reads a collection of trees from stdin and collapses nodes that have children of the same species.

Usage¶

Example:

python <script_name>.py --help

Type:

python <script_name>.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

python ../scripts/tree_collapse_species.py [OPTIONS] < tree.in > tree.out

Version: $Id: tree_collapse_species.py 2782 2009-09-10 11:40:29Z andreas $



Options:
-h, --help                      print this message.
-v, --verbose=                  loglevel.
-p, --pattern-species=          regex pattern to extract species from identifier
option --no-usage not recognized
